p: By investigating the relationship between the creep curve ( Figure 2) and nanocrystalline NiAl model amorphization, we found that the height and shape of the RDF peaks at 1200 K did not change much with time, but the peaks at 1400 K changed significantly with time. This is because the model entered the tertiary creep stage at 40 ps and 1400 K, and the creep rate was faster than at steady-state creep. Therefore, the height of the peaks in the RDF curve dropped significantly. Another conclusion can be derived from Figure 3, namely that the crystalline structure of the model remains substantially stable when the creep deformation process is in a steady state.
